verses.text: In that day Tobit remembered the money which he had committed to Gabael in Rages of Media,
and said with himself, I have wished for death; wherefore do I not call for my son Tobias, that I may signify to him \add of the money\add* before I die?

And when he had called him, he said, \add My\add* son, when I am dead, bury me; and despise not thy mother, \add but\add* honour her all the days of thy life, and do that which shall please her, and grieve her not.
Remember, \add my\add* son, that she saw many dangers for thee, \add when thou wast\add* in \add her\add* womb; \add and\add* when she is dead, bury her by me in one grave.

\add My\add* son, be mindful of the Lord our God all \add thy\add* days, and let not thy will be set to sin, or to transgress his commandments: do uprightly all thy life long, and follow not the ways of unrighteousness.
For if thou deal truly, thy doings shall prosperously succeed to thee, and to all them that live justly.
Give alms of thy substance; and when thou givest alms, let not thine eye be envious, neither turn thy face from any poor, and the face of God shall not be turned away from thee.
If thou hast abundance, give alms accordingly: if thou have \add but\add* a little, be not afraid to give according to \add that\add* little:
for thou layest up a good treasure for thyself against the day of necessity.
Because that alms doth deliver from death, and suffereth not to come into darkness.
For alms is a good gift unto all that give it, in the sight of the most High.

Beware of all whoredom, \add my\add* son, and chiefly take a wife of the seed of thy fathers, and take not a strange \add woman to\add* wife, which is not of thy fatherâ€™s tribe: for we are the children of the prophets, Noe, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob: remember, \add my\add* son, \add that\add* our fathers from the beginning, \add even\add* that they all married wives of their own kindred, and were blessed in their children, and their seed shall inherit the land.

Now therefore, \add my\add* son, love thy brethren, and despise not in thy heart thy brethren, the sons and daughters of thy people, in \add not\add* taking a wife of them: for in pride \add is\add* destruction and much trouble, and in lewdness \add is\add* decay and great want: for lewdness is the mother of famine.

Let not the wages of any man, which hath wrought for thee, tarry with thee, but give him \add it\add* out of hand: for if thou serve God, he will \add also\add* repay thee: be circumspect, \add my\add* son, in all things thou doest, and be wise in all thy conversation.
Do \add that\add* to no man which thou hatest: drink not wine to make thee drunken: neither let drunkenness go with thee in thy journey.
Give of thy bread to the hungry, and of thy garments to \add them that are\add* naked; \add and\add* according to thine abundance give alms; and let not thine eye be envious, when thou givest alms.
Pour out thy bread on the burial of the just, but give nothing to the wicked.
Ask counsel of all \add that are\add* wise, and despise not any counsel \add that is\add* profitable.

Bless the Lord \add thy\add* God alway, and desire of him that thy ways may be directed, and \add that\add* all thy paths and counsels may prosper: for every nation hath not counsel; but the Lord himself giveth all good \add things\add*, and he humbleth whom he will, as he will; now therefore, \add my\add* son, remember my commandments, neither let them be put out of thy mind.
And now I signify \add this\add* to thee, that I committed ten talents to Gabael the \add son\add* of Gabrias at Rages in Media.
And fear not, \add my\add* son, that we are made poor: \add for\add* thou hast much \add wealth\add*, if thou fear God, and depart from all sin, and do \add that which is\add* pleasing in his sight.
